item.title: KrisT add a quote by Jacqueline Kelly
item.description: "One day I would have all the books in the world, shelves and shelves of them. I would live my life in a tower of books. I would read all day long and eat peaches. And if any young knights in armor dared to come calling on their white chargers and plead with me to let down my hair, I would pelt them with peach pits until they went home." -- Jacqueline Kelly

item.title: KrisT add a quote by Anna Quindlen
item.description: "Books are the plane, and the train, and the road. They are the destination, and the journey. They are home." -- Anna Quindlen

item.title: KrisT add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is no friend as loyal as a book." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: KrisT add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "When each day is the same as the next, itâ€™s because people fail to recognize the good things that happen in their lives every day that the sun rises." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: KrisT add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen
